title: Entropy of closed system over time

content.question: A closed system consists of two adjacent chambers containing the same ideal gas. Initially, one chamber is hot and the other chamber is cold. Which of the following best explains the change in entropy of this closed system over time?

choices.label: The entropy increases over time because the process is irreversible.
The entropy stays the same because it is a conserved quantity.
The entropy decreases because the system moves toward a more orderly state of uniform temperature.
Nothing can be determined about the change in entropy without knowing how many moles of gas are in each container.

content.answer: The entropy increases over time because the process is irreversible.
